Article Title: SC expunges HC judge’s remarks against top court, warns against indiscipline
Article Text: NEW DELHI: A Supreme Court bench of top five judges on Wednesday expunged “unnecessary, gratuitous and unwarranted” remarks from Punjab and Haryana HC judge Rajbir Sehrawat’s July 17 order that had cast doubts on the SC’s majesty and wisdom but, wary of further damage to the institution’s image, restrained itself and let off the judge with a caution.The bench of CJI D Y Chandrachud and Justices Sanjiv Khanna, B R Gavai, Surya Kant and Hrishikesh Roy agreed with attorney general R Venkataramani and solicitor general Tushar Mehta that Justice Sehrawat had damaged the judiciary’s image and said, “Observations (of Justice Sehrawat) of the nature which have proliferated in the video can cause incalculable harm to the sanctity of the judicial process.”However, they refrained from issuing a notice to him. “Doing so would place the judge in a situation of being subject to a judicial adjudication or inquiry by the SC, which we are inclined to desist from doing at this stage. We hope and trust needful circumspection will be observed in future,” the CJI-led bench said while ordering that the HC judge’s controversial remarks be expunged.“However, this court in exercise of its affirmative obligations as a custodian of the adjudicatory process would be failing in its duty if it were not to intervene by expunging the remarks, which we hereby do. The remarks in the July 17 order are accordingly expunged with an expression of caution that such an exercise would not be required to be taken by this court in the future in relation to the same judge or any other judge,” it added.Justice Sehrawat, who was appointed as a judge of Punjab and Haryana HC on July 10, 2017, is scheduled to retire on Oct 30. “To prevent any further damage to the reputation and majesty of the rule of law and the Supreme Court and also of this court, the impugned order dated July 17, 2024, passed by the single judge shall remain stayed till the next date of hearing,” a bench said .
Article Summary: A Supreme Court bench of top five judges on Wednesday expunged “unnecessary, gratuitous and unwarranted’ remarks from Punjab and Haryana HC judge Rajbir Sehrawat. The bench of CJI D Y Chandrachud and Justices Sanjiv Khanna, B R Gavai, Surya Kant and Hrishikesh Roy agreed with attorney general R Venkataramani and solicitor general Tushar Mehta.

Article Title: Bill for oversight of Waqf Boards likely in Lok Sabha today
Article Text:
Oppn wants bill be sent to parl panel,

Muslim bodies

threaten to launch stir

NEW DELHI: Amid opposition ’s demand that it be sent to a joint committee, the govt is set to introduce the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, in Lok Sabha on Thursday that proposes far-reaching changes to restrain the powers of Waqf Boards to declare a property as ‘Waqf’ and introduce a detailed process to do so, including preliminary survey by the district magistrate instead of the survey officer of the board as a pre-requisite for any such determination.The bill seeks to broaden the composition of the Central Waqf Council and state Waqf Boards by providing for representation of Muslim women and non-Muslim members.The bill also provides for a full-time chief executive officer of Waqf Boards to be appointed by the state govt and who shall not be below the rank of joint secretary to the state govt and not necessarily a Muslim.The most critical of the proposed amendments relates to the repeal of Section 40 of the existing law that empowers Waqf Boards to decide if a property is a Waqf asset, change in the composition of Waqf tribunals and allowing for appeals in high courts against their decisions within 90 days.Accordingly, the provision in the current Act which says “decision of the tribunal in respect of such matter shall be final” will be dropped. Introduced in 2013 under the Congress-led UPA govt , this provision has been a bone of contention.To address a long-pending demand, the bill also provides for establishment of separate Board of Auqaf for Bohras and Agakhanis; besides providing representation of Shias, Bohras, Agakhanis and backward Muslims in Waqf Boards.Issuance of a ‘Waqf deed’ and certification will be mandatory for new properties under assessment.The move comes amid strong opposition by the All India Muslim Personal Law Board which has threatened to launch a mass movement, and organisations like Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind.At the meeting of the Business Advisory Committee , opposition parties demanded that the legislation be sent to a parliamentary committee .Sources said parliamentary affairs minister Kiren Rijiju , also the minister of minority affairs, said the govt would take a decision on Thursday.Interestingly, with the department-related standing committees not in place yet, the bill may be forwarded to a special committee in case govt accepts the opposition’s demand.
Article Summary: The govt is set to introduce the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, in Lok Sabha on Thursday. The bill proposes far-reaching changes to restrain the powers of WaqF Boards to declare a property as ‘Waqf’ and introduce a detailed process to do so. The move comes amid strong opposition by the All India Muslim Personal Law Board which has threatened to launch a mass movement.

Article Title: TOI explains: Bid to introduce transparency, accountability in Waqf boards
Article Text:
What is Waqf and what does it comprise in terms of assets?

What are the challenges posed by the

irrevocability

of Waqf?

How did Waqf and its law evolve?

How are the sweeping powers sought to be curbed under the bill?

How has the definition of Waqf changed from 1923 to 2013?

How cases and complaints have piled up

What did Sachar Committee and other panels say on the Waqf system?

What’s the broader idea behind the amendments?

What’s the Muslim Personal Law Board saying?

NEW DELHI: The government is set to introduce a bill to amend the Waqf Act , 1995, to check the unbridled powers, enhanced futher by a 2013 amendment, of Waqf Boards in what has been termed an attempt to introduce transparency and accountability in the regulation and monitoring of over 8.7 lakh properties under control of state boards across the country and weed out corruption. TOI explains what comprises Waqf and what is ailing management of assets under the boards.Waqf refers to properties dedicated exclusively for religious or charitable purposes under Islamic law.Once designated as Waqf, ownership is transferred from the person making the Waqf (waqif) to Allah, making it irrevocable. These properties are managed by a mutawwali, appointed by waqif or a competent authority. Waqf boards control 8.7 lakh properties spanning 9.4 lakh acres across India, with estimated value of Rs 1.2 lakh crore. There are 32 Waqf boards, including two Shia Waqf boards (in Uttar Pradesh & Bihar).Once a property is declared Waqf, it remains so forever. This irrevocability has led to various disputes and claims, some of which, like the claim on two islands in Bet Dwarka, have perplexed courts. Examples of some other disputes include the Bengaluru Eidgah ground, claimed as Waqf property from the 1850s, and the Surat Municipal Corporation building, claimed due to its historical use as a ‘sarai’ during Haj in the Mughal era. Kolkata’s Tollygunge Club and Royal Calcutta Golf Club are on Waqf land, so is ITC Windsor Hotel in Bengaluru. Encroachment on Waqf properties is also a challenge.The concept of Waqf in India dates back to Delhi Sultanate, with early examples including Sultan Muizuddin Sam Ghaor’s (Muhammad Ghori) dedication of villages to Jama Masjid of Multan. Mussalman Waqf Act, 1923, marked the first attempt to regulate it. In independent India, the Waqf Act was first passed by Parliament in 1954. It was replaced by a new Waqf Act in 1995 which gave more power to Waqf boards. The accretion of power has been accompanied by increase in number of complaints of encroachment and illegal lease and sale of Waqf properties. In 2013, the Act was amended and the changes, many argue, conferred unlimited powers on Waqf boards to claim properties in the name of Muslim charity. The amendments made sale of Waqf properties impossible. Neither the mutawwali (custodian) nor the Waqf board has rights to sell a Waqf property.Section 40 of the Waqf Act, 1995, gives Waqf boards the power to decide if a property is Waqf property. There are complaints this power has been misused by vested interests for property grab with the help of the corrupt Waqf bureaucracy. There have also been allegations of misuse of powers given to boards regarding appointment of mutawwalis and cases challenging appointment of managers. The bill proposes to repeal the controversial section altogether and vest powers in the collector. Interestingly, even countries that follow Muslim law do not have a Waqf body with such powers.The main change in definition was made in 2013, when the expression ‘permanent dedication by a person professing Islam’ was replaced by ‘permanent dedication by any person’. After this amendment, it is believed Waqf has opened the floodgates for dedication of property to Waqf boards by any person.Disputes have mounted over the years, and the Waqf bureaucracy has been criticised for inefficacy, leading to issues like encroachment, mismanagement, ownership disputes, and delays in registration and surveys. There are 40,951 cases pending in tribunals which are part of the Waqf system. The problem is compounded by the absence of judicial oversight on decisions of tribunals which exclusively comprise members of Waqf bureaucracy. The law has been under growing public scrutiny after 2013, with complaints coming from Muslim intellectuals, women and different sects such as Bohras, and OBC Muslims.Flaws in the appeal process are also a big concern. For instance, an appeal against a board decision lies with the tribunal but the latter has no timeline for disposal of cases. The tribunal’s decision is final and there is no provision for appeal except under writ jurisdiction in high courts. Moreover, some states don’t have tribunals, making the Waqf bureaucacy the ultimate arbiter.In states with a single Waqf board, the need is felt to have representation from minority sects among Muslims, like Bohras and Shias, as well as OBC Muslims, the Pasmandas. Misuse of ‘Waqf-al-Aulad’ provision to deny inheritance rights to women and orphans in certain cases is another concern sought to be aaddressed by the bill.Sachar Committee’s 2006 report recommended need for regulation, efficient management of records, inclusion of non-Muslim technical expertise in Waqf management and bringing Waqf under the scheme of financial audit, among other things. Similarly, the joint parliamentary committee’s report on Waqf presented to Rajya Sabha in March 2008 recommended revamping the composition of Waqf boards, proposing appointment of a senior officer as CEO for state Waqf boards, stringent action for unauthorised alienation of Waqf properties, stringent punishment to mutawwalis for corruption, creating scope for intervention by HC in some cases, computerisation of Waqf boards and adequate representation to the Shia community in the Central Waqf Council.The idea, govt says, is to modernise management of Waqf properties, protect women’s rights, ensure fair representation in Central Waqf Council and Waqf boards, reduce litigation, have effective coordination with revenue dept and also provide judicial oversight on tribunal decisions.The All India Muslim Personal Law Board has called the bill an interference with personal laws, and threatened to start a mass movement. But the All India Sufi Sajjadanashin Council, the apex body representing Sufi shrines, has welcomed govt’s proposal alleging Waqf boards work in a “dictatorial” manner.
Article Summary: Waqf refers to properties dedicated exclusively for religious or charitable purposes under Islamic law. The concept of Waqf in India dates back to Delhi Sultanate, with early examples including Sultan Muizuddin Sam Ghaor’s dedication of villages to Jama Masjid of Multan. In 2013, the Act was amended and the changes, many argue, conferred unlimited powers onWaqf boards to claim properties in name of Muslim charity.

Article Title: BJP slams Khurshid’s reported remark, says it exposes Cong intent to create anarchy
Article Text: NEW DELHI: BJP on Wednesday launched a fierce attack on Congress over former Union minister Salman Khurshid ’s reported remark about the possibility of India facing a situation similar to one unfolding in Bangladesh.Former Union minister Anurag Thakur said the Congress neta’s remark had laid bare Congress’s wish and intent to create anarchy. “Their actions and words inside Parliament and outside it have exposed their frustration over the third consecutive defeat.They are hell bent upon creating unrest and push the country into anarchy ,” Thakur said.At a book release function on Tuesday evening, Khurshid was quoted as saying that though “everything may look normal on the surface, what is happening in Bangladesh could happen in India”.“Congress has been repeatedly trying to create a crisis in the country, sometimes before the elections and sometimes post-elections. They are frustrated and will do anything to push the country, a bright global spot, backwards due to political vendetta . The statement is an invitation to anarchy and shows the anti-democratic outlook of the a party which talks about the Constitution,” Thakur told reporters.His colleagues, Rajiv Pratap Rudy and Sambit Patra also joined in the attack.The sharp response coincides with growing apprehension in govt and BJP quarters over what they call a plot to organise disruptions by engineering protests. Home minister Amit Shah had late last month cautioned BJP CMs against plots to organise protests by farmers and others.Patra said Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, who was present at the book launch event along with Khurshid, kept mum about his colleague’s objectionable statement. “This is a serious issue. When we are witnessing such a situation in neighbouring countries, the main opposition party Congress wants the same situation in India,” he told reporters outside Parliament. He also referred to Rahul Gandhi ’s “objectionable” remarks during his visits abroad.Rudy dubbed Khurshid’s comments as “anarchist”. “He is a member of CWC, this is an anarchist statement, I think it is a kind of sedition. It’s unfortunate Congress is resorting to such anarchist statements to hide its failure.”
Article Summary: Former Union minister Anurag Thakur said the Congress neta’s remark had laid bare Congress's wish and intent to create anarchy. Khurshid was quoted as saying that “everything may look normal on the surface, what is happening in Bangladesh could happen in India’

Article Title: Neeraj Chopra: 'If Neeraj Chopra wins gold...': Rishabh Pant leads social media trends ahead of javelin throw final at Paris Olympics
Article Text: NEW DELHI: As India's golden boy Neeraj Chopra gears up for the final of the javelin throw event at the Paris Olympics , social media is ablaze with the trend "if Neeraj Chopra wins gold, I will pay...". This unique wave of support and promises from fans and celebrities alike has added to the excitement and anticipation surrounding Chopra's performance.Neeraj Chopra, the reigning Tokyo Olympics gold medallist and world champion, set the stage on fire with a monstrous throw of 89.34 meters in his first attempt during the qualification round at Stade De France on Tuesday.His impressive throw quickly secured him a spot in the final, scheduled for Thursday, leaving fans eager for another golden moment.Among the many supporters, India's dynamic wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant has taken the lead in this social media trend . Pant announced on X that he would reward a lucky winner with Rs 100089 if Neeraj clinches the gold medal."If Neeraj Chopra wins a gold medal tomorrow, I will pay 100089 Rupees to a lucky winner who likes the tweet and comments the most. And for the rest, the top 10 people trying to get attention will get flight tickets. Let’s get support from India and outside the world for my brother," Pant wrote.Pant's announcement has sparked a flurry of similar promises from fans and other celebrities, all rallying behind Neeraj Chopra with creative and generous pledges.Earlier before Neeraj took the field in Paris, Mohak Nahta , CEO of the Indian-origin visa startup Atlys, made a bold and unprecedented pledge. Nahta promised to offer free visas for one entire day if Neeraj Chopra secures the top spot on the podium. His LinkedIn post quickly went viral, generating immense excitement and curiosity."If Neeraj Chopra secures the top spot on the podium, Atlys will provide free visas for one entire day to all its users. This means anyone, regardless of nationality, can apply for a visa to any country without incurring any costs. I will personally send a free visa to everyone if Neeraj Chopra wins a gold at the Olympics. Let’s go," Nahta posted.Nahta clarified that the free visas would be available for all countries at no cost to the applicants, further fueling the enthusiasm surrounding Chopra's performance.With the final just around the corner, the social media trend "if Neeraj Chopra wins gold" has captivated the nation, bringing fans together in support of India's biggest medal hope. As the wait for another Neeraj special continues, all eyes will be on the Stade De France, eagerly anticipating a historic moment for Indian sports.
Article Summary: Neeraj Chopra set the stage on fire with a monstrous throw of 89.34 meters in his first attempt during the qualification round at Stade De France on Tuesday. Rishabh Pant announced on X that he would reward a lucky winner with Rs 100089 if Neeraj clinches the gold medal. Mohak Nahta, CEO of the Indian-origin visa startup Atlys, promised to offer free visas for one entire day if Chopra secures the top spot on the podium.

Article Title: Congress to push for removal of 50% reservation cap, seek quotas in big projects outsourced by govt
Article Text: NEW DELHI: With the quota space shrinking at a rapid rate, Congress is set to ratchet up pressure for removal of 50% ceiling on reservation and push for quotas in the big projects outsourced by govt. The decision came as the party decided to hold consultations within and outside on the sub-categorisation of Scheduled Castes to finalise its stance in the wake of the recent Supreme Court judgement .A brainstorming by the Congress brass, led by Mallikarjun Kharge, with key leaders, decided to hold extensive dialogue with the party’s state units, chief ministers, INDIA bloc allies and civil society members for feedback on the sensitive issue.Sources said the meeting elicited individual views of participants. Many of them criticised the judgment’s extension of “creamy layer” concept to SCs and STs. Meanwhile, in Lok Sabha, DMK’s A Raja slammed “creamy layer” for SCs/STs and urged govt to introduce safeguards to protect the rights of the two communities in the light of the court judgement.The participants discussed the pros and cons of sub-classification while also quoting the views of BSP’s Mayawati and BJP ally LJP’s Chirag Paswan — both have opposed it.The meeting included Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, KC Venugopal, Abhishek Singhvi, Vivek Tankha, Charanjit Channi, Kumari Selja, PL Punia, Mukul Wasnik, Randeep Surjewala, Udit Raj, Rajesh Lilothia, Nasir Hussain and Jairam Ramesh.While the Congress, like other parties, is treading with caution on sub-categorisation, party insiders felt there was need to up the pressure on other fronts where the longstanding reservation pie is shrinking. Udit Raj said the party will renew its demand that the 50% bar on total SC/ST/OBC reservation be relaxed through a constitutional amendment. Also, the Congress will ask govt to fill “backlog vacancies” and institute quotas inoutsourced projects — the logic being that outsourcing of govt work is leading to erosion of reservation available in govt appointments. There is also likely to be increased rhetoric against privatisation of PSUs.Meanwhile, civil society groups will hold a nationwide bandh against sub-categorisation on Aug 21, and will see the involvement of some Congress leaders too.Many feel that sub-categorisation also concerns tribals, besides Dalits, and discussions will have to include the ST representatives. The Congress meeting did not have any ST member. The issue is of special concern to election-bound Maharashtra and Jharkhand because of their large SC/ST population, while Haryana has the highest dalit population in the country after Punjab.
Article Summary: The Congress is set to ratchet up pressure for removal of 50% ceiling on reservation and push for quotas in the big projects outsourced by govt. The decision came as the party decided to hold consultations within and outside on the sub-categorisation of Scheduled Castes.

Article Title: Govindarajan Padmanabhan to receive first Vigyan Ratna award
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Celebrated biochemist Govindarajan Padmanabhan was selected for the first ‘Vigyan Ratna’ award, the top-most science award in the country, while Isro ’s Chandrayaan-3 team was selected for the first ‘Vigyan Team’ award with the govt on Wednesday announcing 33 names for the ‘ Rashtriya Vigyan Puraskar ’ 2024 under four categories.Padma Bhushan awardee Padmanabhan is an honorary professor at IISc , Bengaluru.The list of 33 awardees include 18 ‘Vigyan Yuva: Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar’ award for young scientists and 13 ‘Vigyan Shri’ awards. The awards will be presented by President Droupadi Murmu in Rashtrapati Bhavan on National Space Day August 23.‘Vigyan Ratna’ will be awarded to recognise lifetime achievements and contributions in a given field of science and technology, whereas ‘Vigyan Shri’ will be given to recognise distinguished contributions. ‘Vigyan Yuva’ award is meant to recognise and encourage young scientists while ‘Vigyan Team’ award will be given to a team comprising three or more scientists who have made an exceptional contribution.The govt had instituted ‘Rashtriya Vigyan Puraskar’ in Jan by rationalising all science awards in the country on the lines of Padma awards where the awardees will be given a medallion and ‘sanad’ (citation). Unlike earlier science awards, Rashtriya Vigyan Puraskar will not have a cash component.
Article Summary: The list of 33 awardees include 18 ‘Vigyan Yuva: Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar’ award for young scientists. The awards will be presented by President Droupadi Murmu in Rashtrapati Bhavan on August 23.

Article Title: UAPA tribunal upholds ban on SIMI, cites links to ISIS
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The tribunal established by the Centre to review the ninth extension of the ban on the Students Islamic Movement of India (SIMI) under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act has upheld the ban. The decision was based on evidence from the Phulwarisharif PFI case , which involved a conspiracy to disrupt Prime Minister Narendra Modi ’s visit to Patna in July 2022, as well as other ISIS-inspired terror plots under investigation by the NIA and several state police forces.The order of the UAPA tribunal , put out in a gazette notification issued on Tuesday, stated that based on evidence and material provided to it, “it is evident that SIMI continues to engage in unlawful and terrorist activities despite being banned”.It added: “The organization is expanding its ranks by indoctrinating young boys and operating through front organizations. SIMI maintains connections with various terrorist groups such as Al-Qaeda, Lashkar-e-Taiba, Jaish-e-Mohammed, ISIS and Indian Mujahideen. It continues to receive both domestic and international funding, which supports its activities in India... it is clear that several accused persons, who have committed various offences across different jurisdictions, have been identified as members or activists of SIMI. By conspiring together, they committed numerous offences aligned with SIMI's ideologies and propaganda”.The tribunal observed that the evidence in cases involving ex-SIMI cadres — who are now either affiliated with Popular Front of India (PFI), also banned under UAPA, or found to be carrying out ISIS propaganda and plotting/executing attacks to further the global terror outfit’s ideology favouring Islamic rule — “effectively establishes the fact that despite the previous bans, SIMI is still active through its members and activists.”One of the key testimonies relied upon by the tribunal while confirming the ban on SIMI is that of NIA officer Vipin Kumar, who had deposed that the key accused in Phulwarisharif PFI case, Athar Parvej and Jalaluddin, were connected with SIMI members and taking their help for planning and commission of terrorist acts.The investigators had recovered incriminating documents titled ‘India 2047: Towards Rule of Islam in India’ that chronicled how PFI intends to replace democratic govt in India with Islamic rule by creating disaffection and getting cadres trained in use of crude weapons, to commit violent acts. Parvej had confessed that he, on PFI’s direction, was preparing a secret group of ex-SIMI members to avenge “atrocities against Muslims and derogatory remarks against Islam” and cited the targeted attacks against Hindu individuals in Amravati and Udaipur. The PFI ‘vision document’ found his Parvej’s home was the basis for declaration of the organization as an “unlawful association” under UAPA in 2022. The entire PFI leadership was arrested in the wake of the ban.
Article Summary: The tribunal established by the Centre to review the ninth extension of the ban on the Students Islamic Movement of India (SIMI) has upheld the ban. The decision was based on evidence from the Phulwarisharif PFI case, which involved a conspiracy to disrupt Prime Minister Narendra Modi ’s visit to Patna in July 2022.

Article Title: India exported 2.6 lakh tonne onions in Apr-July
Article Text: NEW DELHI: India exported 2.6 lakh tonne of onions till July of this fiscal year, govt said Wednesday. “Govt has lifted the onion prohibition from May 4 and allowed the export with minimum export price of $550 per tonne and export duty of 40%.“Till July 31, a total quantity of 2.6 lakh tonne of onion had been exported in current financial year 2024-25,” minister of state for food and consumer affairs B L Verma said in a written reply in Lok Sabha.India had exported 16 lakh tonne of onions in the last fiscal. Further, he said govt had procured 4.6 lakh tonne, majorly from Maharashtra, through NCCF and NAFED for the price stabilisation buffer.“In comparison with last year, the price realisation by onion farmers in current year has been much higher. The average monthly mandi modal prices of onion in Maharashtra between April and July were in the range of Rs 1,230 to Rs 2,578 per quintal as against Rs 693 to Rs 1,205 per quintal for corresponding period last year,” Verma said. The average procurement price of onion for the buffer in current year was Rs 2,833 per quintal.
Article Summary: India exported 2.6 lakh tonne of onions till July of this fiscal year, govt said. “Govt has lifted the onion prohibition from May 4 and allowed the export with minimum export price of $550 per tonne and export duty of 40%.”

Article Title: Why temp jobs are here to stay
Article Text:
Growing tide of temp jobs studies

Skilled pros take centre stage gone

Project-based challenges: Escape the monotony of a routine job and tackle exciting new projects.

Escape the monotony of a routine job and tackle exciting new projects. Upskilling opportunities: Exposure to new technologies and industry trends, enhancing professional development.

Exposure to new technologies and industry trends, enhancing professional development. Flexibility: Manage worklife balance with greater control over schedules.

The blurring lines of tenure

Gig work: A growing appetite

Investing in skills is key

Embracing the future

Preparing for transience

The writer is co-founder, TeamLease, and an independent board director

The Indian job market is at an inflection point. While the traditional full-time model persists, a silent revolution is brewing — the rise of temporary work. Let’s delve into the data-driven future of temporary staffing in India, exploring its potential impact on job structures, skill sets, and the overall employment landscape.Studies by the World Employment Confederation and International Labour Organisation (ILO) paint a clear picture: temporary work is on the rise globally.India is no exception. Reports from TeamLease, a leading staffing firm, indicate a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 16.3% in the temporary staffing market for 2022. Experts predict this trend to continue, with the temporary workforce potentially doubling by 2030 to touch a staggering 10 million. This points to a significant shift from the present, paving the way for a more transient job market.Gone are the days of temporary work being synonymous with basic, repetitive tasks. A report by global staffing companies highlights a crucial trend — temporary jobs are climbing up the value chain. Companies are increasingly seeking highly skilled professionals for projectbased work, peak seasons, or specialised expertise. This shift is driven by factors like globalisation, technological advancements, and the need for agility. This presents a unique opportunity for skilled professionals.Temporary work can offer:While reports by ILO acknowledge the rise of temporary work, they also caution against job insecurity. But the reality is that traditional job security — with defined career paths and long tenures — is becoming less prevalent and, as a matter of fact, it impedes the ability to maximise dignified earnings in the dynamic world we live in today. Companies are increasingly adopting a projectbased approach, requiring a more adaptable workforce. This doesn’t negate the need for job security, but rather redefines it. The future lies in portable skills, adaptability, and a robust social security system that supports temporary workers.The rise of the gig economy , fuelled by digital platforms, further underscores the growing acceptance of temporary work arrangements. Organisations are showing a greater appetite for gig workers, particularly for tasks like marketing, content creation, and data analysis. This trend is expected to surge — a Nasscom-Aon report predicts a 78% increase in India’s gig workforce by 2025 to reach an estimated 25 million gig workers.This translates into a significant portion of the workforce embracing the flexibility and project-based nature of gig work. While income variability exists, a report by Aspire Circle (a leading gig work platform) indicates an average income of Rs 25,000 per month for skilled gig workers in India. The figure can vary depending on the specific skill, experience level, and platform used. However, it highlights the potential for gig work to provide a competitive income stream for skilled individuals.To truly harness the potential of temporary work, a focus on skill development is paramount. Reports by TeamLease emphasise the need for investments in creating industryspecific skill sets across all levels. Apprenticeship programmes, as championed by the government, can act as a vital gateway to employment, equipping individuals with the necessary skills to thrive in the temporary job market.The future of work in India extends beyond just temporary jobs. It’s a paradigm shift towards a more agile and adaptable workforce. McKinsey’s remote work study reveals that a significant portion of tasks can be done remotely, potentially impacting talent pools for temporary roles. The World Economic Forum ’s “Reskilling Revolution” emphasises the need to equip workers with in-demand skills like complex problem-solving and creativity. Similarly, reports by PwC and EY highlight the rising demand for specialised skills in temporary positions.This dynamic landscape demands a multi-pronged approach. We need robust investments in skill development programmes tailored to the evolving needs of the temporary job market. Apprenticeship initiatives and industry-specific skilling efforts must be prioritised. Additionally, social security measures need to be adopted to provide a safety net for temporary workers.By embracing this future of work, India can unlock a wave of opportunity. It’s time to move beyond traditional models and empower a skilled, adaptable workforce ready to thrive in the transient job market. Let’s equip India for the future, today.As Milton Friedman, the Nobel laureate economist, aptly stated, “The key is to be skilled and adaptable. The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.” By prioritising skilling and embracing adaptability, India can ensure its workforce is not just prepared for the transient future, but actively shaping it. The writer is co-founder, TeamLease, and an independent board director.
Article Summary: The Indian job market is at an inflection point. While the traditional full-time model persists, a silent revolution is brewing — the rise of temporary work. Companies are increasingly seeking highly skilled professionals for projectbased work, peak seasons, or specialised expertise.

Article Title: Thin & fair?: Brides-to-be say it’s time to not care
Article Text:
(mothermonials.com site, enabled with AI, is also assisting women to express themselves better)

Fair. Beautiful. Thin. These attributes once part of matrimonial ads are making way for the new beauty gauge — confidence, intelligence, emotional maturity and a touch of ‘chocolate/caramel skin’ — as society is fully primed to shift from long-held, longunquestioned societal norms.Boxed in by narrow beauty standards perpetuated by matrimonial advertisements with trite descriptors, young women and brides-to-be are coming under unrealistic expectations and pressure.Now, the kids on the marriage block are embracing their authentic selves . Brides-to-be are among the worse impacted by societal pressure to meet beauty standards, often feeling the need to conform to certain ideals just to find a suitable partner.However, a new generation is pushing back against these narrow definitions of beauty. Jenny John, 24, shared her journey of self-acceptance with TOI. Once told her ‘dark’ skin would make marriage prospects tough, Jenny now celebrates her “chocolate/caramel skin” as an asset. “I feel it’s my strength, my beauty. I don’t wonder or fear anymore about getting married. I know there will be people who will love me for who and what I am intrinsically,” she said.Bride-to-be Meghna K expressed similar sentiments. After years of feeling pressured to conform to societal beauty standards, she’s now embracing her brown skin and curvy body. “Growing up, I felt I had to fit certain descriptions to be considered worthy. But now, I realise how limiting and harmful these ideas are. I’ve decided to reject outdated norms and embrace my true self,” she said.It’s not just young adults and brides-to-be. Teenagers have also felt the pressure of this matrimonial culture. “For years, I felt pressured to be fair and slim because that’s what I saw in matrimonial ads,” said Reshma Shirin, a 19-year-old student.“It took me years to take pictures without filters that whitewash us. Society wants us to be whitewashed; when we try, they call us fake. It’s all about the right people who make you feel loved for being yourself. No filters. No whitewashing. Just pure love from people who appreciate your beauty, both inside and outside,” she added.Matchmakers across Bengaluru have noticed this shift in attitudes. Meenaka Kumar, a seasoned matchmaker, observed that men are no longer solely focused on physical appearances, and women are crafting more honest, empowered profiles.“People are looking for traits like smart, financially independent, and politically aware partners,” Kumar noted, indicating a broader change in marriage priorities. Poornima Bhasker, a relationship adviser, echoed these observations.She highlighted that women are making smarter choices and valuing their confidence, intelligence, and emotional maturity over traditional beauty standards . Beauty brand Dove, in partnership with TOI, is trying to turn traditional matrimonials promoting outdated beauty standards into empowering ‘mothermonials’ that inspire society to see brides beyond stereotypes.
Article Summary: Young women and brides-to-be are coming under unrealistic expectations and pressure. Teenagers have also felt the pressure of this matrimonial culture. Beauty brand Dove, in partnership with TOI, is trying to turn traditional matrimonials into empowering ‘mothermonials’

Article Title: Gujarat ATS busts drugs units, arrests four
Article Text: The Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) raided a flat in Maharashtra’s Bhiwandi Tuesday and busted a mephedrone manufacturing unit , seizing 793.23kg liquid MD worth around Rs 800 crore and arresting two men. A joint team of ATS and SOG also busted a tramadol making ring in Bharuch, confiscating 1,410 litres of liquid tramadol — worth over Rs 31 crore, and arrested two men.
Article Summary: The Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) raided a flat in Maharashtra’s Bhiwandi Tuesday and busted a mephedrone manufacturing unit. A joint team of ATS and SOG also busted a tramadol making ring in Bharuch.

Article Title: Govt: Kavach on Delhi-Mumbai, Delhi-Howrah lines by Mar 2025
Article Text: NEW DELHI: After the Kanchanjungha Express tragedy, railways will come out with a unified subordinate rules in the next 10 days that will specify speed and precautions that loco pilots need to take when there is signal failure in autom-atic signalling sections to avoid misinterpretation by drivers.The national transporter will prioritise Kavach deployment on such sections (5,000 km) and will also roll out installing of the automatic train protection (ATP) system in 10,000 locos and 9,000 km track from Oct.Railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said tenders for these works will be out in the next three months. The section on which Kavach will be deployed include Mumbai-Chennai and Chennai-Kolkata rail corridors. Vaishnaw said Kavach system will be fully deployed on Delhi-Mumbai and Delhi-Howrah stretch by March 2025. He added that railways can deploy 4,000 km of the protection system annually.“With this we will have Kavach installed in half of the locos or train engines,” he said.Officials added that all new trains will come pre-installed with Kavach 4.0. The system prevents trains from exceeding safe speeds or ‘Passing Signals At Danger’ and automatically controls train’s speed and can apply brakes to prevent accidents, if the pilot fails to do so.Currently, 1,465 kilometres of railway network have the Kavach system. Medha Servo Drives , HBL Power Systems and Kernex Microsystems are the three firms that have been certified to deploy Kavach.Vaishnaw also said that the railways will complete the process of required mapping of the 8,000 stations by Dec and a tender will be floated for installation of the devices. Sources said while the focus is on faster deployment of the current version of Kavach, railways is also working on developing Kavach 6.0.
Article Summary: Railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said tenders for these works will be out in the next three months. The section on which Kavach will be deployed include Mumbai-Chennai and Chennai-Kolkata rail corridors. The system prevents trains from exceeding safe speeds and can apply brakes to prevent accidents.

Article Title: Diplomats stay on in Bangladesh, families & others sent home
Article Text:
Hasina still stuck in India

NEW DELHI: Amid the continued threat of violence in Bangladesh, India withdrew all non-essential staff and families from the Indian high commission in Dhaka. The high commission remains functional with Indian diplomats and officials going about their business as usual.Significantly, as reports emerged that the Muhammad Yunus-led interim govt will be sworn in on Thursday, a senior functionary of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party ( BNP ), which has had a rocky relationship with India, told TOI the party wants healthy ties with India.“Our acting chairman ( Tarique Rahman ) has maintained that a country’s people can change its economy, politics and govt but they can never change their neighbours. We want a healthy relationship with India,” said A K M Wahiduzzaman, who is information and technology affairs secretary with the BNP. The party has been invited by the military to join the interim govt.Currently in exile in Malaysia, Wahiduzzaman is an aide to London-based Rahman who is BNP leader and Sheikh Hasina ’s long-time rival Khaleda Zia ’s son. The official said BNP workers were working to quell violence in the country, including against minorities. “They are guarding police stations where there’s no police and also temples,” he said.Asked about the choice of Nobel Laureate Muhammad Yunus as the head of the interim govt, Wahiduzzaman said this issue was not really of concern to the BNP as it seeks an early return to democracy. “An unelected govt for too long won’t be good for Bangladesh. We want elections to be held in the next 3 to 6 months,” he said, as he denied reports that Rahman has returned to Dhaka from London.Indian officials did not confirm if they have had any contact yet with BNP which has been accused by supporters of Hasina of joining anti-India Jamaat-e-Islami in transforming students protests against Hasina into a movement for regime change.Govt sources said the return of non-essential staff and families from Indian high commission in Dhaka had taken place on a voluntary basis and through commercial flights. “All diplomats remain there and the high commission is functional,” said a source.With asylum not forthcoming from anywhere, Sheikh Hasina remained at a “safe house” in India. Her continued presence here will likely put India in a bind as the new dispensation in Dhaka is unlikely to approve of it. Hasina’s son Sajeeb Wazed was quoted as saying by a German agency Wednesday that she will likely remain in Delhi for now as there is no decision yet on moving to another place.
Article Summary: India withdrew all non-essential staff and families from the Indian high commission in Dhaka. The high commission remains functional with Indian diplomats and officials going about their business as usual. A senior functionary of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party ( BNP ), which has had a rocky relationship with India, told TOI the party wants healthy ties with India.

Article Title: PM tells Vinesh Phogat she’s pride of every Indian, asks PT Usha to explore ways to help wrestler's case
Article Text: NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday expressed solidarity with ace wrestler Vinesh Phogat after her heartbreaking disqualification from the Paris Olympics and spoke to Indian Olympic Association president P T Usha to lodge a strong protest with the International Olympic Committee to explore ways if the games administration could still revisit the ruling.“The PM spoke to Usha and sought first-hand information on the issue and the options India has in the wake of Vinesh’s setback. He asked Usha to explore the full range of options to help Vinesh’s case,” a govt source said.Consoling Vinesh over her disqualification, Modi said on X, “Vinesh, you are a champion among champions. You are India’s pride and an inspiration for each and every Indian. Today’s setback hurts. I wish words could express the sense of despair that I am experiencing. At the same time, I know that you epitomise resilience. It has always been your nature to take challenges head on. Come back stronger. We are all rooting for you.”In a statement in Lok Sabha, sports minister Mansukh Mandaviya said the PM had asked Usha, who is in Paris, to take “appropriate action” in the matter. Later, he said the IOA had lodged a strong protest with United World Wrestling after Vinesh was disqualified.Wishing many laurels in future for Vinesh, President Droupadi Murmu said she “embodied the truly indefatigable spirit of Indian women, and her epic fortitude and resilience were already inspiring future world champions from India”.Home minister Amit Shah said Vinesh’s setback had broken the hopes of millions of Indians. “She has a brilliant sporting career, shining with the glory of defeating the world champion. This misfortune is merely an exception in her trailblazing career, from which I am sure she will bounce back to be the winner she always is. Our best wishes and support are always with her,” he said.
Article Summary: PM Narendra Modi expressed solidarity with ace wrestler Vinesh Phogat after her heartbreaking disqualification from the Paris Olympics. Modi spoke to Indian Olympic Association president P T Usha to lodge a strong protest with the International Olympic Committee to explore ways if the games administration could still revisit the ruling.

Article Title: Morari Bapu concludes nine-day spiritual event at UN
Article Text: Spiritual leader Morari Bapu concluded a nine-day Ram Katha discourse at the United Nations Headquarters. The event, held from July 27 to August 4, marked the first time a spiritual leader led such an event at the UN , focusing on themes of peace, unity, and global harmony.He dedicated his discourse to the United Nations, emphasizing its role in fostering global peace .After the event, he walked to the General Assembly Hall, where he placed a copy of the Ram Charita Manas, a version of the Ramayana by Goswami Tulsidas, and recited the Vedic hymn:During the event, Bapu met with UN Deputy Secretary-General Amina J Mohammed, who noted, “While you had circumambulated the United Nations Headquarters building earlier, you are now at its heart.” She also emphasized the alignment of his teachings with the UN's mission, particularly the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).Morari Bapu responded by pledging that his “Vyaspeetha will always be with the UNO program for world peace, world progress, and world happiness.” He also called on world leaders to rise above narrow interests and work towards ending conflicts in places like Israel and Ukraine.Throughout the event, Morari Bapu connected themes from the Ram Charita Manas to the United Nations’ SDGs, particularly in promoting peace, environmental sustainability, and social justice. He used the example of Ram Rajya, the rule of the ideal king Lord Ram, to illustrate a model code of life that aligns with the principles upheld by the UN.
Article Summary: Morari Bapu concluded a nine-day Ram Katha discourse at the United Nations Headquarters. The event, held from July 27 to August 4, marked the first time a spiritual leader led such an event at the UN. He dedicated his discourse to the UN, emphasizing its role in fostering global peace.

Article Title: India's online visa portal now accepting applications from Chinese nationals for e-Business visas
Article Text: NEW DELHI: India’s online visa portal has enabled Chinese nationals to apply for e-business visas , facilitating fast-track approvals for those coming in to execute projects under the production-linked incentive scheme.Sources in the government said China has been added to the drop down menu for online application of e-business visas.“The existing visa portal has added China to the drop-down menu to enable Chinese and other foreign nationals to apply for e-business visas for PLI projects,” said an officer.E-business visas, which involve a processing time of just 72 hours, allow multiple entries and have a validity of 365 days, with a continuous stay during each visit not exceeding 180 days.
Article Summary: India’s online visa portal has enabled Chinese nationals to apply for e-business visas. The move will fast-track approvals for those coming in to execute projects under the production-linked incentive scheme. E- business visas involve a processing time of just 72 hours.

Article Title: Maharashtra government woos minorities ahead of polls, sets up Minority Research & Training Institute
Article Text: MUMBAI: In a bid to woo minority community votes a decision was taken in the state cabinet to establish a Minority Research and Training Institute ( MRTI ) on the lines of ' Babasaheb Ambedkar Research and Training Institute (BARTI), Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Research, Training and Human Development Institute (SARTHI), Mahatma Jyotiba Phule Research & Training Institute (MAHAJYOTI) and Academy for Maharashtra Research, Upliftment and Training (AMRUT) for overall development and removing backwardness of the minority community.Samajwadi Party MLA Rais Shaikh said setting up MRTI is a welcome move, but govt must make fund allocations immediately and this announcement shouldn't turn out to be an election gimmick.“Mahayuti govt's decision to set up the MRTI is certainly a welcome move. I wrote multiple letters on this issue to the govt highlighting how the students from the minority community are being deprived of the benefits that other communities are getting through BARTI, Mahajyoti, Saarthi, Amrut, etc. This was a much needed move to ensure benefits of higher education to the students of disadvantaged minority communities. However, the state govt must make adequate budgetary allocations for the same. We want to see this announcement turning it into reality. It shouldn't be election propaganda to woo the Muslim community ahead of the assembly elections,” Shaikh said.“A total of 11 posts will be created for this organization. Similarly, the cabinet has also approved a total expenditure of Rs. 6.25 crore is expected. Muslims, Jains, Buddhists, Christians, Jews, Sikhs, Parsis are the minority citizens of the state. Problems related to their social, educational, economic development will be studied through this institution,” said an official.
Article Summary: A decision was taken in the state cabinet to establish a Minority Research and Training Institute. Samajwadi Party MLA Rais Shaikh said setting up MRTI is a welcome move, but govt must make fund allocations immediately. Muslims, Jains, Buddhists, Christians, Jews, Sikhs, Parsis are the minority citizens of Maharashtra.

Article Title: Postal dept to deliver invitations for I-Day event at Rashtrapati Bhavan
Article Text: MUMBAI: The Maharashtra Postal Circle will handle delivery of local invitation cards for the 'At Home Reception' to be hosted by President Draupadi Murmu at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Independence Day Aug 15.A postal team has undergone specialised training to handle this task, and it has implemented enhanced protocols to guarantee timely delivery. Article Title: Chennai Metro Rail phase 2: Tunnel boring machine achieves breakthrough
Article Text:
The TBM has built a tunnel for a length of around 703 metre, including 51 metre under the river Cooum .

CHENNAI: A tunnel boring machine named Siruvani -- that started tunnelling from Chetpet station to Sterling Road junction station in September 2023 as part of the phase-2 project of Chennai Metro Rail -- achieved a breakthrough on Monday.A release said the TBM built a tunnel for a length of around 703 metre, including 51 metre under the river Cooum.The stretch is part of the 12km underground section of corridor-3 from Kellys to Taramani which is being executed by Larsen & Toubro Limited.L&T is mobilising eight TBMs in the stretch.The two stations are part of the 45.4km corridor-3 from Madhavaram Milk Colony to Siruseri Sipcot linked by 28 underground stations and 19 elevated stations. The 116.1km phase-2 will have three corridors.
Article Summary: A tunnel boring machine named Siruvani started tunnelling from Chetpet station to Sterling Road junction station in September 2023. The stretch is part of the 12km underground section of corridor-3 from Kellys to Taramani. The 116.1km phase-2 will have three corridors.

Article Title: Body of Indian techie Siddhant Vitthal Patil recovered from US national park after weeks of search
Article Text: After weeks of searching, rangers at Glacier National Park in Montana have recovered the body of Indian techie Siddhant Vitthal Patil , a 26-year-old tech professional from India who fell into Avalanche Creek on July 6 and drowned.Patil, who was living and working in California at the time of the incident, was hiking with seven friends above a gorge on the Avalanche Lake Trail when he diverted from the path and fell into the creek while standing on a large rock.Despite briefly resurfacing, he was swept away by the current into the gorge."After weeks of searching, rangers at Glacier National Park believe they have recovered the body of 26-year-old Siddhant Vitthal Patil from India today after Patil fell into Avalanche Creek on July 6, 2024, and drowned," said park officials in a statement.They added, "Clothing and gear similar to what, according to friends, Patil was wearing at the time of the incident were also recovered. Around 10.30 am today (local time), a park visitor reported seeing a body in Avalanche Creek below the gorge. Rangers immediately began recovery efforts. Flathead County coroner is working to confirm identity through DNA or dental records."The search for Patil's body was challenging due to submerged obstacles such as fallen trees and rocks, which limited the rangers' ability to investigate the gorge for weeks because of water depth and whitewater conditions during spring and summer runoff. As the water level dropped, rangers used long poles to search large portions of the gorge but were unable to reach the deepest and most dangerous areas.According to Glacier National Park officials, Patil was hiking with friends above a gorge on the Avalanche Lake Trail on July 6 when he diverted from the trail. While standing on a large rock, he fell into Avalanche Creek. It remains unclear whether he slipped on a wet portion of the rock or lost his balance. Friends and witnesses saw him fall into the creek, go underwater, resurface briefly, and then be swept away by the current into the gorge."An alert helicopter conducted aerial searches of the creek, and rangers scoured the area on July 6, recovering personal items that had washed downstream. During the past four weeks, ground search efforts have continued from the gorge to the bridge on the Trail of the Cedars," added the statement from park officials.Rangers used a drone multiple times to search the gorge. The Trail of the Cedars and Avalanche Lake Trail were temporarily closed during the recovery efforts and reopened around 3:30 pm local time.Park officials extended their condolences to Siddhant Vitthal Patil's family and friends, expressing hope that recovering the body would help bring closure to his loved ones. Patil was living and working in California at the time of the incident.Siddhant's uncle Pritesh Chaudhari told news agency ANI that US ranger officials informed them about the recovery of Patil's body. Chaudhari expressed gratitude to the rangers and Indian American community leader Prem Bhandari for supporting the family during the search."We were informed by the US ranger officials that Siddhant's body was found. As we are grappling with this grief, we also like to thank the rangers for carrying out this search. A special mention to Prem Bhandari who has been in constant touch with us for the last 27 days and supporting us. We have authorized Bhandari to arrange for Siddhant's remains to be sent to Pune and complete the formalities," Chaudhari told ANI.Prem Bhandari, a prominent Indian diaspora leader assisting in repatriating the mortal remains to India, stated that park officials offered their condolences to the family and hoped that recovering the body would help bring closure to loved ones. The next step is to repatriate the mortal remains to the grieving family. In a statement to ANI Bhandari said, "When I spoke to the Park officials they offered condolences to the family and hoped that recovering the body would help bring closure to loved ones. The next step is to repatriate the mortal remains to the family.
Article Summary: Siddhant Vitthal Patil, a 26-year-old tech professional from India, fell into Avalanche Creek on July 6 and drowned. After weeks of searching, rangers at Glacier National Park in Montana have recovered the body of Patil. Flathead County coroner is working to confirm identity through DNA or dental records.

Article Title: On Vinesh's shock disqualification, Mahavir Phogat says, if wrestler is 50-100 grams overweight...
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Indian grappler Vinesh Phogat was on Wednesday disqualified from the 50 kg women's wrestling event at the ongoing Paris Olympics 2024 for exceeding the weight limit, shattering India's hopes for their fourth medal.Despite attempts to address the issue, Vinesh was found a few grams over the 50 kg mark, leading to her disqualification before her gold Medal match against the United States's Sarah Ann Hildebrandt.Vinesh's uncle Mahavir Singh Phogat was seeming frustrated with her ouster, stressing on the acceptance of slight weight deviations in wrestling."I have nothing to say. The entire country has expected Gold...Rules are there but if a wrestler is 50-100 grammes overweight, they are usually allowed to play. I will ask the people of the country not to despair, one day she will bring a medal for sure...I'll prepare her for the next Olympics," Mahavir Singh Phogat said while speaking to ANI.Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended his support to Vinesh following her disqualification."Vinesh, you are a champion among champions! You are India's pride and an inspiration for each and every Indian. Today's setback hurts. I wish words could express the sense of despair that I am experiencing. At the same time, I know that you epitomise resilience. It has always been your nature to take challenges head-on. Come back stronger! We are all rooting for you," the PM said in a post on X.According to sources, the Prime Minister also contacted Indian Olympic Association (IOA) President PT Usha to discuss the situation. He sought firsthand information on the issue and options available for India's response. Additionally, he encouraged PT Usha to file a strong protest regarding Vinesh's disqualification if it could potentially help her case.A statement from the Indian Olympic contingent earlier confirmed Vinesh's disqualification due to exceeding the weight limit."It is with regret that the Indian contingent shares news of the disqualification of Vinesh Phogat from the Women's Wrestling 50 kg class. Despite the best efforts by the team through the night, she weighed in a few grams over 50 kg this morning. No further comments will be made by the contingent at this time. The Indian team requests you respect Vinesh's privacy. It would like to focus on the competitions on hand," the statement read.The disqualification is particularly disheartening as Vinesh had secured her place in the gold medal bout after defeating Cuba's Yusneylis Guzman Lopez 5-0 in the semi-finals.
Article Summary: Vinesh Phogat was disqualified from the 50 kg women's wrestling event at the ongoing Paris Olympics 2024 for exceeding the weight limit. Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended his support to Vinesh following her disqualification. The Prime Minister also contacted Indian Olympic Association (IOA) President PT Usha.

Article Title: Mhada lottery for 2,030 flats in Goregaon, Powai, Malad on September 13
Article Text:
MHADA

MUMBAI: Mhada's Mumbai Board has announced a housing lottery for the sale of 2,030 flats in various housing projects at Pahadi Goregaon, Antop Hill-Wadala, Kopri Powai, Kannamwar Nagar in Vikhroli and Shivdham Complex in Malad. Online registration and application begins Aug 9 for the lottery that will be conducted Sept 13.The draw will feature 359 flats for the economically weaker section (EWS), 627 flats for the lower income group (LIG), 768 flats for the middle-income group (MIG) and 276 flats for the higher income group (HIG).These include 1,327 newly constructed flats by Mhada, of which 370 have been obtained as housing stock from developers under redevelopment projects according to DC Regulations 33(5), 33(7), and 58. Apart from these, there are 333 "scattered flats" from previous lotteries.The annual family income limit is Rs 6 lakh for EWS, Rs 9 lakh for LIG, Rs 12 lakh in MIG and above Rs 12 lakh for HIG. Applicants from EWS can apply for houses both in EWS and LIG while LIG persons may apply for both LIG and MIG categories. Individuals from the middle income group can apply in both MIG and HIG categories. Those from the higher income group can only apply in the HIG category.The deadline for submitting online applications is 3.00 pm Sept 4. The online deposit amount will be accepted that very day. The computerised lottery will be conducted at 11.00 am Sept 13.The process for online registration and application will be launched by Mhada vice president and CEO Sanjeev Jaiswal at a live event on Friday, Aug 9.Applicants can use the mobile app 'Mhada Housing Lottery System' and seek guidance on Mhada's website https://housing.mhada.gov.in . Meanwhile, the lottery advertisement will be published Aug 8 on the website along with an information booklet.
Article Summary: Mhada's Mumbai Board has announced a housing lottery for the sale of 2,030 flats. Online registration and application begins Aug 9 for the lottery that will be conducted Sept 13. Draw will feature 359 flats for the economically weaker section (EWS), 627 flats for lower income group (LIG), 768 flats for middle-income group (MIG)

Article Title: Read internal 'job cuts memo' that Dell sent to its sales team as the company plans to lay off thousands
Article Text:

Segmentation and coverage

As we simplify, standardize and focus — and become a more modern organization — we'll extend our lead as the world's best go-to-market sales team. We have a winning strategy to propel our growth. It's a journey, and we'll adjust as we go.

Bill and John

Bill Scannell, President, Global Sales & Customer Operations

John Byrne, President, Sales, Global regions, Dell Tech Select

PC giant Dell is cutting more jobs. According to a report in Business Insider, Dell is laying off thousands of workers as part of a major reorganization of its sales teams to prepare for an AI world. Article Title: Puri district included in National Health Research Priority Project
Article Text: BHUBANESWAR: The Centre has started a National Health Research Priority Project for developing an advanced emergency care system . It will be implemented in five districts of the country, including Puri in Odisha .The project aims to develop a high-quality, patient-centric integrated model for the emergency care system in five districts: Puri in Odisha, Ludhiana in Punjab, Vidisha in Madhya Pradesh, Vadodara in Gujarat, and Pondicherry.AIIMS Bhubaneswar , in collaboration with the Indian Council of Medical Research ( ICMR ) and the Odisha govt, is spearheading the project in Odisha.“The initiative will enhance emergency care by improving logistics, boosting healthcare provider competencies, integrating information technology and artificial intelligence tools, and mapping facilities,” said AIIMS Bhubaneswar Executive Director Ashutosh Biswas.He said key components of the project include improving ambulance services, increasing community demand, and training first-level responders. The project will address seven critical emergencies: heart attack, brain stroke, trauma, snake bite, poisoning, respiratory emergencies, and neonatal and maternal emergencies, he added.He emphasized the collaborative nature of the initiative during a National Level Consultation cum Review Meeting held at AIIMS Bhubaneswar. The meeting, themed “Collaborative Action: Strategies to Strengthen Emergency Care in India,” gathered key stakeholders to discuss strategies for enhancing emergency care.A research team led by Dr Arvind Kumar Singh, an additional professor at AIIMS Bhubaneswar, has been formed to develop and implement this model in collaboration with the state govt.Meenakshi Sharma from ICMR, New Delhi, experts from different medical institutions of the country, and principal investigators from the five project sites attended a national-level consultation cum review meeting between August 2 and August 4 for the strengthening of the Emergency Care System (INDIA-EMS) in India. The consultation meeting was organised with the theme of ‘Collaborative Action: Strategies to Strengthen Emergency Care in India’ followed by training for the project team.Biswas unveiled the vision document of INDIA EMS and training manuals, advocating for the integration of geo-tagging systems, IT, and other systems. He emphasized improvements in transport, ALS facility ambulances, immediate response, and community education on basic life support. Bijay Kumar Mohapatra, Director of Health Services, stressed the importance of enhancing the emergency healthcare system in Odisha.
Article Summary: The project aims to develop a high-quality, patient-centric integrated model for the emergency care system in five districts. The project will address seven critical emergencies: heart attack, brain stroke, trauma, snake bite, poisoning, respiratory emergencies, and neonatal and maternal emergencies.

Article Title: Railway to issue unified rules to specify speed limits when there is signal failure in Automatic Signalling Sections; fast-track Kavach roll out
Article Text: NEW DELHI: After the Kanchanjunga train tragedy, now the railways will come out with a unified Subordinate Rules in the next 7-10 days that will specify the speed and precautions that loco pilots need to take when there is signal failure in Automatic Signalling Sections to avoid misinterpretation by drivers. The national transporter will prioritise Kavach deployment on such sections (5,000 km) and will also roll out installing of the automatic train protection (ATP) system in 10,000 locos and 9,000 km track from Oct.Speaking to reporters, railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said the tenders for these works will be bid out in the next three months. The section on which the Kavach system will be deployed include Mumbai-Chennai and Chennai-Kolkata rail corridors. He said the Kavach system will be fully deployed on Delhi-Mumbai and Delhi-Howrah stretch by March 2025. He added that now the railways can deploy 4,000 km of the train protection system annually.“With this we will have Kavach installed in half of the locos or train engines,” he added. Officials added that all new trains will come pre-installed with Kavach 4.0. The system prevents trains from exceeding safe speeds or ‘Passing Signals At Danger’ and automatically controls the train’s speed and can apply brakes to prevent accidents, if the pilot fails to do so.Currently, 1,465 route kilometres of railway network have the Kavach system. Medha Servo Drives, HBL Power Systems and Kernex Microsystems are the three firms that have been certified to deploy Kavach. Another two companies are likely to get the approval in the next two months.Vaishnaw also said that the railways will complete the process of required mapping of the 8,000 stations by December and a tender will be floated for installation of the devices. Sources said while the focus is on faster deployment of the current version of Kavach, the railways is also working on developing Kavach 6.0, which will replace existing automatic signalling.
Article Summary: Railways will come out with a unified Subordinate Rules in the next 7-10 days. The rules will specify the speed and precautions that loco pilots need to take when there is signal failure in Automatic Signalling Sections. The national transporter will prioritise Kavach deployment on such sections (5,000 km)
